item.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7201) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide incentives for energy production and conservation, and for other purposes and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7202) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend certain expiring provisions, to provide individual income tax relief, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1533, H. Res. 1516 is laid on the table.

item.title: Providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules and waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of the rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules.

latestAction.text: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1533, H. Res. 1526 is laid on the table.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 169 (Roll no. 685). (text: CR H10871)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 169 (Roll no. 685).(text: CR H10871)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 224 - 174 (Roll no. 684). (consideration: CR H10876)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 1533, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the nays had prevailed. Mr. Dreier demanded the Yeas and Nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question on H.Res. 1533 until a time to be announced.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1533.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H10871-10876, H10876-10877)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 289.

The resolution waives the requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII for a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House with respect to any resolution reported through the legislative day of December 13, 2008, providing for consideration or disposition of a measure relating to financial assistance to eligible automobile manufacturers, and for other purposes. House Resolutions 1516 and 1526 are laid on the table.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-918, by Ms. Slaughter.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-918, by Ms. Slaughter.

summary.text: Waives a specified requirement of Rule XIII (Calendar and Committee Reports) to allow consideration or disposition of a measure (relating to financial assistance to eligible automobile manufacturers) on the same day it is presented to the House.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Waives a specified requirement of Rule XIII (Calendar and Committee Reports) to allow consideration or disposition of a measure (relating to financial assistance to eligible automobile manufacturers) on the same day it is presented to the House.

bill.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of Rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
